SENT.plain: We report here a case of acute pancreatitis revealing Behcet's disease in an 18-year-old woman
Pancreatitis was due to ischemia secondary to severe abnormalities of the celiac trunk arteries with pseudo-aneurysms
The outcome was favourable after the administration of corticosteroids and cyclophosphamide
The patient did not experience relapse of pancreatitis 2 years after diagnosis
